channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2024010161
item.description:
Report X-2024010161

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: NOTIFIED BY DRIVER SUPERVISOR, OF A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE IN PACKAGE CAR ON ROAD. RESPONDER ACQUIRED LEAKING PACKAGE DECISION TREE, AND DONNED REQUIRED PPE. INSPECTION OF HAZMAT PACKAGE, REVEALED PACKAGE CONTENTS TO BE A CORROSIVE. RESPONDER USED CORROSIVE SOLIDS / LIQUIDS RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP SPILLAGE ON PACKAGE CAR FLOOR. RESPONDER TRANSPORTED CONTAINERIZE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND ABSORBED MATERIAL BACK TO THE SERVICE CENTER DMP AREA IN LINED SPILL TRAYS FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024010055
item.description:
Report E-2024010055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSX experienced a UN3266 Galvbrite-EM release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of material released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer and dock floor due to a puncture. The material was transferred via gravity feed into a new poly tote. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: EMPLOYEE FOUND A PACKAGE THAT WAS WRAPPED IN BLACK PLASTIC, RESPONDER CALLED. AFTER INSPECTION OF THE PACKGE RESPONDER FOUND THAT THERE WAS A PACKAGE WITH NO AUDIT PAPERS AND NITROUS OXIDE CLASS 2 AND CLASS 5.1 LABLES ON THE PACAKGE THE PROGRESS WAS STOPPED, CHAIN OF COMMAND WAS FOLLOWED.

item.title: Report X-2023121166
item.description:
Report X-2023121166

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-17
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The tank car was reported leaking during movement by UPRR yard personnel. Haz Mat Manager Tom Robinson was called for a response. The Tank car was found to have a broken Pressure relief device. The remaining part of PRD was bagged, covered, and the spillage cleaned off the car. The shipper is getting a new pressure relief valve and will get an OTMA for the car to be brought back to the loading rack to be unloaded.

item.title: Report X-2024010337
item.description:
Report X-2024010337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-26
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was already in QA when hazmat team arrive. The package was wet and torn an all side and placed in a bag. On inspection, the package was damage due to internal leakage. DescribePack: One of the jerricans had a loose cap and leaked it's contents in the box. There is no content left inside that jerrican but the remaining three are in good condition. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was double bagged and place in a black tub for hazmat.

item.title: Report E-2024010001
item.description:
Report E-2024010001

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: WALLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 22, 2023, one (!) 55-gallon drum of UN1133 was damaged in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lonestar Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel utilized granular absorbents, hand tools, and a vacuum unit to remediate the UN1133-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023120645
item.description:
Report X-2023120645

  • City: MISSOURI CITY

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was improperly loaded with the arrows not facing upwards. Poor handling led to loose closures leaking. At discovery, area was cleared of employees and the hazmat was securely placed in a hazardous material bucket to await processing. DescribePack: loose caps on all 4 bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The area was cleaned with absorbent mats. Package handlers were trained on what to do with a hazardous damage.

This allowed approximately 45 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Lonestar Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.description:

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The loose cap led to the leakage. Improper handling allowed to occur. The package was not loaded correctly with the arrows upwards. At discovery, the hazmat was removed from the area and put into a secured hazardous material bucket and awaited processing. DescribePack: Loose caps failed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Area of spill was properly cleaned with absorbent mats. Package handlers were given safety tips and continued training on proper loading.

item.title: Report E-2024010022
item.description:
Report E-2024010022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2023, at 1945 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of a total of (2) quarts of SHIELD-BRITE ® VACATE (UN1719 Caustic Alkali Liquids, n.o.s. (Sodium Hydroxide, Potassium Hydroxide) 8, II) from (6) 5-gallon plastic pails. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by defective seals in the caps on top of the pails and contained to a 5’ x 6’ area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to neutralize the release and clean it with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, and recovered product was placed in (2) 55-gallon DF's and then taken offsite by contractors.

item.title: Report X-2023120684
item.description:
Report X-2023120684

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: TYLER
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER DROPPED THE BOX AND THE PLASTIC PAIL CRACKED ON THE BOTTOM. DescribePack: CRACKED ACROSS THE BOTTOM OF PAIL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT IN A TOTE
